intro: Horminum caulescens, commonly known as the slender-stemmed orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of Europe. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, erect stems covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in a raceme, which bloom in early spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and alternate along the stem, often with a slightly hairy texture. Horminum caulescens prefers moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or shaded meadows.
